other_tests.findings: Pathological studies revealed a neoplasm composed of large epithelial cells with large nuclei and prominent nucleoli, consistent with malignant melanoma. Neoplastic cells reacted positively for HMB-45 and S100 protein.
Placement indicated due to hydrocephalus from a posterior fossa mass.

other_tests.changes_over_time: Revision was needed for proximal failure.

other_tests.findings: Residual posterior fossa tumor was resected, revealing lumbar drop metastases.
